DataElement.preferredName: Busulfan Overall Drug Exposure Measurement Dose Unit of Measure Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The unit of measure that represents a determinate amount or quantity of the busulfan overall drug exposure.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A synthetic derivative of dimethane-sulfonate with antineoplastic and cytotoxic properties.  Although its mechanism of action is not fully understood, busulfan appears to act through the alkylation of DNA.  Following systemic absorption of busulfan, carbonium ions are formed, resulting in DNA alkylation and DNA breaks and inhibition of DNA replication and RNA transcription. (NCI04)_Including everything._Contact with drug._Measurement is the determination of the size or magnitude of something.  It is also used ro refer to the result of this act.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A synthetic derivative of dimethane-sulfonate with antineoplastic and cytotoxic properties.  Although its mechanism of action is not fully understood, busulfan appears to act through the alkylation of DNA.  Following systemic absorption of busulfan, carbonium ions are formed, resulting in DNA alkylation and DNA breaks and inhibition of DNA replication and RNA transcription. (NCI04):Including everything.:Contact with drug.

Concepts.definition: A synthetic derivative of dimethane-sulfonate with antineoplastic and cytotoxic properties.  Although its mechanism of action is not fully understood, busulfan appears to act through the alkylation of DNA.  Following systemic absorption of busulfan, carbonium ions are formed, resulting in DNA alkylation and DNA breaks and inhibition of DNA replication and RNA transcription. (NCI04)

Property.preferredDefinition: Measurement is the determination of the size or magnitude of something.  It is also used ro refer to the result of this act.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Busulfan Dose Unit of Measure Name
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A synthetic derivative of dimethane-sulfonate with antineoplastic and cytotoxic properties.  Although its mechanism of action is not fully understood, busulfan appears to act through the alkylation of DNA.  Following systemic absorption of busulfan, carbonium ions are formed, resulting in DNA alkylation and DNA breaks and inhibition of DNA replication and RNA transcription. (NCI04)_A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time._A named quantity in terms of which other quantities are measured or specified, used as a standard measurement of like kinds._The words or language units by which a thing is known.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Target Total Area under Curve Minute Times Nanomole per Milliliter

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Target Total Area under Curve Minute Times Nanomole per Milliliter
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The goal intended to be attained.: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete.: The area between the x-axis and the curve given by the integrand. It is equal to the definite integral of a function. In the field of pharmacokinetics, the area under the curve (AUC) is the area under the curve in a plot of concentration of a drug in plasma against time. AUC is usually given for the time interval zero to infinity, and other time intervals are indicated.: Minutes times nanomoles per milliliter.

Concepts.definition: An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination.
Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.

The area between the x-axis and the curve given by the integrand. It is equal to the definite integral of a function. In the field of pharmacokinetics, the area under the curve (AUC) is the area under the curve in a plot of concentration of a drug in plasma against time. AUC is usually given for the time interval zero to infinity, and other time intervals are indicated.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of a mass fraction expressed as a number of milligrams of substance per kilogram of mixture. The unit is also used as a dose calculation unit.

Concepts.definition: A unit of a mass fraction expressed as a number of milligrams of substance per kilogram of mixture. The unit is also used as a dose calculation unit.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A metric unit of areal density equal to approximately 2.94935E-5 ounce per square yard. Also used as a dose calculation unit.

Concepts.definition: A metric unit of areal density equal to approximately 2.94935E-5 ounce per square yard. Also used as a dose calculation unit.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The quantity of a substance per unit volume or weight; a measure of the amount of substance present in a unit amount of mixture, particularly, the amount of solute dissolved in a solvent. The amounts can be expressed as moles, masses, volumes, or parts.: Having reached equilibrium for the measurement or phenomenon concerned.

Concepts.definition: The quantity of a substance per unit volume or weight; a measure of the amount of substance present in a unit amount of mixture, particularly, the amount of solute dissolved in a solvent. The amounts can be expressed as moles, masses, volumes, or parts.
Having reached equilibrium for the measurement or phenomenon concerned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The area between the x-axis and the curve given by the integrand. It is equal to the definite integral of a function. In the field of pharmacokinetics, the area under the curve (AUC) is the area under the curve in a plot of concentration of a drug in plasma against time. AUC is usually given for the time interval zero to infinity, and other time intervals are indicated.

Concepts.definition: The area between the x-axis and the curve given by the integrand. It is equal to the definite integral of a function. In the field of pharmacokinetics, the area under the curve (AUC) is the area under the curve in a plot of concentration of a drug in plasma against time. AUC is usually given for the time interval zero to infinity, and other time intervals are indicated.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the units of measure for assessment results and dosing.
